answers.answer: HiWelcome to the forum!Tingling in head and neck, and upper chest can be seen in peripheral neuropathies as in diabetes. It is also seen in peripheral vascular disease. Compression of cervical spinal nerves too can cause it. It can also be due to cold and sinusitis. In all probability it is cervical nerve compression. MRI of cervical spine should be done. Without examining you it is difficult to access the situation.Other causes are cerebrovascular accident or stroke (not in your case), head injury, facial nerve injury and compartment syndrome. Please do not ignore it. Get a neurological consultation. Seek another opinion or discuss this with your neurologist. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

I also can't always drive my self, they said I had silent migraines also.  Please do not ignore it, there is so much that can be going on.  Even if they rule out other causes, what is being done to control/prevent the migraine?Is the neurologist following up on this with you?  Have you had an MRI/MRA?  I often have tingling also, and numbness in my arm, loss of balance which causes me to fall, and I am dizzy so driving isn't always the best idea for me either.  But Please do push to find a neurologist that will be sure to rule out eerything else and help you get control of this.  I am sure not trained to say what it is but I can say I do not have panic attacks, but have many or your symptoms.You know yourself best...so push the Drs is you need to if their answers just don't feel right.Keep us posted,Tracy
